intro: Scholtzia drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor nutrient conditions. Its yellow to orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scholtzia drummondii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
